candidates.name: Angela O'Leary
candidates.why_elect: I have served Hamilton as a dedicated City Councillor for 12 years and have the experience to be the best Mayor. I work hard to promote honesty, integrity and genuine transparency. I've served my apprenticeship and I am asking you to trust me with your vote.
candidates.why_stand: It's time you had a Mayor you can trust. I have the courage and integrity to get council and Hamilton back on track. I am the most experienced candidate in this election and as Mayor will put you and our city above all else.

candidates.name: Shanti Ralm
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in our community my whole life and have a wealth of experience of volunteering in the community.
candidates.why_stand: I am passionate about my community and the people that live in it.

candidates.name: Matthew Small
candidates.why_elect: I work as a Disability Support Worker so I have seen two different sides to the world. I'm able to work with and understand both sides of people's positions. Councillors have a different range of views and I will be able to work professionally with whoever else is elected.
candidates.why_stand: Hamilton is a great place to live, but can be a lot better. Thinking big and outside the square on how to improve our city, is what gives me motivation to stand for council this year.

candidates.name: Peter Harry Bos
candidates.why_elect: Over the past 2 decades I have been an active member of Cycle Action Waikato, and over the past decade I have been a supporting member of Living-streets Hamilton.
candidates.why_stand: I want Hamilton to be desirable place for future generations to live and continue into the future.

candidates.name: Sarah Thomson
candidates.why_elect: I bring valuable experience in commercial and community law, and a good understanding of local government issues gained through advocacy work. I am passionate about community well-being and our environment, open minded, have a collaborative leadership style, and value meaningful community engagement.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the council has an important role to play in improving community well-being, and in thinking ahead for future generations. I'm running because we need strong leadership on issues such as climate change and housing, and I haven't seen our current council provide this.

candidates.name: Chris Davis
candidates.why_elect: I grew up on the Westside. I co-own a business with my wife Christine, who recently passed from cancer. I hold: Bachelor Physical Education, Secondary Teaching Diploma, and Bachelor Laws (Waikato). My experience includes both public and private sectors; including teaching, management, governance, law, real estate, sales and tertiary education.
candidates.why_stand: I love Hamilton and I really do want what is best for all of us. I advocate strongly for thorough community consultation to ensure decisions made by council truly reflect what is best for all of us and to work together to unite this awesome city so it thrives.

candidates.name: Rudi Du Plooy
candidates.why_elect: I bring positive change to Hamilton. As a Councillor in Johannesburg for eight years, I worked extensively to improve systems of governance, democracy and transparency. These same values are needed here. I was trained in Political Leadership and governance by the Konrad Adenauer Foundation. I will make a difference.

candidates.name: Ewan Wilson
candidates.why_elect: I have returned from overseas refreshed and reinvigorated after studying in the UK and Canada. I have new ideas and fresh thinking to help make Hamilton even better place to live in. I've been in business including launching Kiwi Air and have 12 years of experience in the city council.
candidates.why_stand: I understand a liveable city is not only about areas of economic excellence, but one with a thriving arts and culture sector. I want Hamilton to lead other NZ cities in its environmental practices. I want to be part of the team that makes it successful, dynamic and vibrant.

candidates.name: Martin Gallagher
candidates.why_elect: I have wide experience in business, education and local government, serving Hamilton as a councillor, Deputy Mayor and Member of Parliament. I have extensive experience as a strong advocate for communities and residents to represent their interests.
candidates.why_stand: I am committed to Hamilton and believe it is a great place to live, work and raise a family.

candidates.name: Louise Hutt
candidates.why_elect: Being the CEO of an electricity company, I understand the responsibility that comes with providing core services. As a board member of Go Eco, I understand the role of governance and the importance of sustainability. I'm passionate about collaboration and ensuring we understand our decisions and how they affect everyone.
candidates.why_stand: I've always been frustrated at how little energy is put into making local body politics understandable for most people (but especially young people) and how few politicians actually centre climate change or wellbeing in their decisions. So kia ora, here I am.

candidates.name: Dave Macpherson
candidates.why_elect: I'm a bulldog; I don't let issues go if I take them up, until they are satisfactorily resolved; I get things done—talking shops bore me. I give value for money! If you want a representative that passes things onto staff, then I'm not your best bet.
candidates.why_stand: At the moment, Hamilton is the fastest growing city in NZ, and my job as a councillor is to ensure we have the infrastructure in place to keep us moving and to provide for residents' and businesses' needs.
